result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan M Gifford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 15 days were granted.
Consecutive to: Current Sentence.  Concurrent with 15CF353.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with any victim or businesses listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is waived on this case. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jonathan M Gifford in court, in custody, with Attorney Peter M Wolff.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #4.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #4.  Counts #2, 6, 8, 10, 11, 12, 13 and 14 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Wolff makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #4:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 15 days)  **CONCURRENT WITH 15CF353**   *CONSECUTIVE TO PRESENT SENTENCE HE IS SERVING* 
  -  18  MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18  MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:  victims/businesses listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges)

COSTS:  $278.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH
